Class OaFValidatorConstructorTest

java.lang.Object
com.beemediate.beemediate.domain.service.OaFValidator.OaFValidatorConstructorTest
public class OaFValidatorConstructorTest extends Object
Unit test class for the OaFValidator constructor.

This test class validates the initialization behavior of the OaFValidator class, focusing on constructor parameter validation and state initialization. The tests ensure that the OaFValidator properly handles edge cases and correctly initializes internal state through the SupplierCatalogReaderPort dependency.

Testing Approach: This class employs unit testing methodologies with Mockito to isolate the OaFValidator constructor from external dependencies. Mock objects are used to simulate catalog behavior, allowing precise validation of constructor logic without requiring actual implementations of the catalog port.

See Also:
  • OaFValidator
  • SupplierCatalogReaderPort
  • EmptyArrayException

    test_constructorwith_manyArticleNumbers()
    Verifies that the OaFValidator constructor correctly initializes the internal articleNumbers field when provided with a valid non-empty catalog.
    void

    Verifies that the OaFValidator constructor throws an exception when a null catalog is provided.
    void
    test_constructorwith_nullReadArticleNumbers()
    Verifies that the OaFValidator constructor throws an EmptyArrayException when the catalog's readArticleNumbers() method returns null.
    void
    test_constructorwith_zeroReadArticleNumbers()
    Verifies that the OaFValidator constructor throws an EmptyArrayException when the catalog's readArticleNumbers() method returns an empty array.

    • test_constructorwith_manyArticleNumbers

      public void test_constructorwith_manyArticleNumbers() throws EmptyArrayException, NoSuchFieldException, SecurityException, IllegalArgumentException, IllegalAccessException
      Verifies that the OaFValidator constructor correctly initializes the internal articleNumbers field when provided with a valid non-empty catalog. Uses Java reflection to validate that the constructor properly stores the article numbers array.
      Throws:
      EmptyArrayException - if the catalog is empty
      NoSuchFieldException - if the articleNumbers field does not exist
      SecurityException - if access to the field is denied
      IllegalArgumentException - if the field access argument is invalid
      IllegalAccessException - if the field cannot be accessed
